answerText: "El Aleph" [or "The Aleph"][10] "El Aleph" is a short story by this Argentine author of Ficciones.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 13 | 7 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This story ends with a description of a pillar at a mosque in Cairo where another one of the title objects can be heard. [10] Name this story that begins with the narrator mourning the loss of Beatriz Viterbo, whose cousin is attempting to write a massive poem and wants to prevent the demolition of his house to preserve the title object in his cellar.
